Recap: Elijah reveals to Tea that he knows of her secret and of her history with Todd. And at that point, when she is asked by the judge to deliver her opening statement, she announces she cannot and announces that Matthew is best served if he gives his own testimony. Schuyler admits to Gigi that maybe it's unrealistic for him to accept being "just friends" with her. So, what he needs to do is "back off". Yet she is clearly not ok with that. Rex tells Roxy he wants nothing more to do with him. She has lied to him throughout his life and she's crossed the line with him. Cristian asks Blair what he should do regarding the fact that he knows that Fish is lying to Layla about being gay. Todd comes by and finds the papers that Blair has had drawn up to find out Tea's big secret. Todd is in the process of filing for joint custody of his kids and being able to live with Tea.
Transcript: Nora: I almost stopped the wedding.
Bo: So did I.
Nora: Why?
Bo: Probably for the same reason you almost did.
[Cell phone ringing]
Nora: It's Clint.
[Ringing stops]
[SCENE_BREAK]
Elijah: Oh, good. You still have a few minutes.
Téa: To do what?
Elijah: To convince Matthew Buchanan to drop his lawsuit.
Téa: Ha ha ha!
Elijah: Ha ha! You can't win, Téa. At least if you back out now, you can save face before I wipe up the floor with you.
Téa: Wipe up the floor with me? Oh, and if you think I care about saving face, you have no idea what I'm made of.
Elijah: Well, there's only one thing I need to know--the secret you're keeping from Todd Manning.

Jack: So, if your plan works and you move out of Aunt Dorian's house, where are you gonna go?
Todd: Back to my place.

Jack: I do, especially when she goes around the house half-naked, but what's Mom gonna say?

Blair: Rough morning? What's going on, Cristian?
Cristian: Tell me something. Why am I trying to mess up a happy couple?
Blair: Any happy couple in particular?
Cristian: Fish and Layla.
Blair: Oh. Oh, oh, oh. I didn't realize they were still going strong.
Cristian: Oh, yeah, even though I saw him kissing someone else.
Blair: You did? Who was it?
Cristian: I can't say.
Blair: Oh, yeah, you can. Come on. It's me. You know, you can trust me.
Cristian: No, Blair. This is complicated.

Cristian: No. This is really complicated.
Blair: What, did you catch him kissing somebody's wife?
Cristian: No.
Blair: What about somebody's husband? Oh, my God, you're serious. It was a guy?
Cristian: Blair, you cannot tell anyone.
Blair: I'm not gonna tell anybody. You saw it?
Cristian: Yeah, with my own eyes.
Blair: Did you tell Layla?
Cristian: No, and I don't know what I'm gonna do. I mean, I did tell Fish that if he didn't say something, I would.
Blair: Well, did he say something to Layla?
Cristian: No. He slept with her.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kyle: Better not come too close. You might catch queer.

Kyle: Oh, really? Which part, about shoving me or accusing me of stalking you?
Oliver: Everything, okay? I apologize. It won't happen again.
Kyle: Really? Why not?
Oliver: Because I figured some things out. College was a very confusing time for me, but I'm not confused anymore. That's all over.
Kyle: Just like that.
Oliver: Look, Kyle, man. I don't expect you to understand. All I ask is that you respect the choices that I make. I have the life that I want. Layla and I are together, like together together.

Stacy: So, you want me to get pregnant again?

Kimberly: And admit defeat? Never. That is not the Stacy Morasco I know. The Stacy Morasco I know wouldn't wallow in self-pity.
Stacy: Meet the new Stacy Morasco. Oh, she surrenders.
Kimberly: You're gonna put on a hot dress right now, your highest heels, and get yourself knocked up before anyone is the wiser.

Rex: I'm right here. What do you want to know, how mad I am at you?

Stacy: You make it sound so easy.

Kimberly: Something a little more traditional.

Stacy: No. No. Sperm banks are too expensive, and I don't want a paper trail. Rex is a P.I. He'll figure it out.
Kimberly: So get pregnant the old-fashioned way.

Rex: Yes, another wonderful thing that couldn't have happened without you. Thanks.

Rex: I don't know. How many ways have you hurt my family and me?

Blair: Some people are.

Cristian: Have you ever kissed a girl?
Blair: No. I'm too busy kissing the wrong guy.
Cristian: Oh, is it possible that Fish isn't even gay? Should I just let this go?
Blair: Uh, it's a tough call. I don't know.

Téa: Who's Todd Manning?

Téa: So what? Everyone knows that.

Elijah: Well, you're right. Everyone in Llanview knows about Todd and Téa, and from what I understand, you guys are back together again, but I'll wager if Todd knew what I know, there wouldn't be any more Todd and Téa. In fact, there might not be any more Téa at all.

Schuyler: Hey, I'm gonna grab a burger. You want to come?
Rachel: Sorry. I'm not really up for it today.

Rachel: Thanks, but no matter who wins, it's not gonna end well.

Rachel: I'm kind of all talked out. I talked to my mother about it. I talked to my brother about it. I even talked to my brother's doctor about it.

Rachel: We had a double date and spent the whole night talking about Matthew's surgery.
Schuyler: Oh, good. Well, at least you got an objective medical perspective.
Rachel: No. What I got was a detailed analysis of my questionable life choices and deep character flaws.
Schuyler: Oh, yeah, the armchair psychiatrist thing. Forget about that.

Greg: Then how about if you listen, I'll apologize?
Schuyler: Ahem, good luck.

Nora: Yeah. No. It hasn't started yet. I completely understand why you're not here. Yeah. I'll tell him. I will. Okay. Yeah. Yeah. You, too. Okay. Bye. That was Clint. He wanted to wish us luck. Look, Bo. I don't want you to get the wrong idea, okay? I almost stopped the wedding because I didn't want my marriage to start out with this secret hanging over my head.
Bo: I know. I know. That's what I was thinking, too. I thought we'd, you know, just get everything out on the table, and then we can all move on.
Nora: Great, only you didn't.

Nora: It-- I don't know. It just-- it seemed for the best. You know, I didn't-- I didn't want to make a big deal about a kiss which obviously meant nothing.

Roxy: Well, you know, if you look at it a certain way--

Stacy: I know. She was living my life, what I always wanted, except for that kid of hers.
Kimberly: Goes without saying.

Kimberly: You really got it bad for this Rex guy, huh?
Stacy: It's pathetic, isn't it?

Kyle: Just meet with me, okay, once, just the two of us. I promise I won't try anything. I just want to talk.

Kyle: Maybe I'm wrong, but it looks to me like you're going through a really hard time. I just want to help.

Kyle: Because, whether or not I like it or not, I still care about you. I just want to make sure you're gonna be okay, you know? I hate to see you like this.
